author: Shasta
comment: Is there any reason why the daily usage doesnt update anymore? It's stuck on nov 17th!! Helps me to know how much i need 2 for the next week

author: Mark Biondo
comment: Used to be great, but now the daily usage is just stuck at a constant 10kw, and does not update. Has been like this since November 2017. Disappointing really.

As a much older person I've found this app easy to navigate, use & understand my power usage. Ive been able to track my daily usage there by lowering it. Making small payments & keeping up to date means no more large bills. Lots of discounts on offer continuously. I would highly recommend Powershop. Thankyou!!

author: Carol Pedersen
comment: Another one here with daily usage stuck on Nov 17. Easy to use other than that.

author: Annabel Mazzotti
comment: Really useful to have such detailed usage information

author: Billy Sheldon
comment: No understanding of what I'm purchasing after the update that removed per unit prices. Have become completely disengaged since remove price per unit

author: Kim Daniel
comment: It is good to help you keep up with your power cost. It has both dollars and kilowatt if you look in the right place even though dollars is easier for me to understand.  So far so good and I am impressed with Powershop so far.  You do have to use the power packs and keep a close eye on it to get the most out of it.  At least you don't get a big bill you dread at the end of the 3 month period.

author: Paulo Cotoviana
comment: I cannot get it to work open.  Have reinstalled to no avail.  Running Android 4.4.2 on Samsung S4.  It says ""This application needs a working data connection."  It has a working connection; it has the correct userid id and password; I have installed the latest version.  No joy.  Will re-evaluate once it is working.

reply.author: Powershop
reply.content: Hi Paulo. Sorry to hear you're having issues with the app. There is a new version of the app released yesterday (1 Nov), can you update to this version and try again? Also if you can check on both a wifi connection and then on a mobile data connection to see if they both give the same error.

author: Gee N
comment: It is impossible to work out what you are about to spend when purchasing new electricity. Tell us what the $ per Kwh is please.  Why tell what we've saved from your own most expensive option?

author: Stuart Nickols
comment: Terrible. How much does a unit cost ffs

author: Deric Ong
comment: Could not view previous month's usage in insights tab in this current version. Please fix.
Simply perfect

author: Mark Micallef
comment: Since update it no longer shows how many units (kWh) I owe. This has been replaced with a vague measure of "days". That's useless. Show me how much electricity I've used in one easy total.

author: Vijayabaskar Rajagopal
comment: While all the estimates and usages are based on the applicable rates for me, why is the packages and the discounts are based on the base rates? Is it to misguide us and lead us to believe that we are getting a lot more percentage of discount than what we are actually getting? Using unit rates everywhere wouldn't have caused this sort of confusion.

author: Angela Meyer
comment: Great to have flexibility in what I buy and what costs are each day.

author: Amy Kidd
comment: Love being able to purchase 100% green energy at a discount price through the app

author: Rachel McIntosh
comment: Great app but very frustrating that I can only buy one future pack at a time. Means lots of small transactions on my credit card! If you fix this, I'll give it 5 stars.

reply.author: Powershop
reply.content: Hi Rachel, this is something we're looking at doing in the app. In the meantime when you've added 1x Future Pack to your cart you can change the amount you'd like to purchase by tapping on the pencil icon in the cart before confirming. Hope this helps

author: sam treloar
comment: Needs work. Setting custom notification tone doesn't change anything, still plays the default tone.

author: whitemackay i
comment: Trying to hide of how much each unit cost. Dont know why they have done this. Everyone has the same complaint but i dont see powershop replying to any of the comments. Guess they dont care about the customers. Ir they give a fluck f@#k to any of these reviews. Another customer lost

author: Benjamin Humphrey
comment: Could you guys please make the icons slightly different for AU & NZ or combine them into a single app? I have properties in both countries!

author: Chris Attwood
comment: As everyone else has said making the pricing less transparent is a big mistake for a company that has set out to attract a user base that is savvy about rates and usage. I too am starting to look for a provider that listens to the customer base and is not afraid to admit when they have made a misstep.

author: Tanja C
comment: I expected to see a change when I had my net meter installed. Not happy!

author: Ivan Kolevski
comment: Well done, one way to lose loyal customer base is to do what you have done...

author: Kyra Fetherston
comment: I thought I was alone when I got frustrated that they had removed the per unit price. My power usage fluctuates a lot depending on the weather (heating/cooling), so the per day usage estimate is never useful. I complained too, but they didn't seem to get it.

author: Josh Backwell
comment: One of the best things about this app & Powershop's approach in general was the way it helped educate people about energy & usage patterns. I'm so disappointed that it's been dumbed down to the point that you can't even see your forecast energy estimate in kWh. Your customers are savvy. Please don't treat us as though we are too stupid to be able to understand. I just updated to the latest version, but it still doesn't tell me how many kWh I've prepurchased & it still doesn't tell me ¢/kWh for powerpacks. Still no response from Powershop!!!!
I can't see my solar feed in balance... And now I have a smart meter, I expected to see my usage and still can't 😧 maybe it's a case of our expectations exceeding technology?

author: Poornima Premaratna
comment: They used to be great. But the new update just made it not user-friendly.  I can't see the usage or forecast in kWh...

author: andrea simpson
comment: You have wrecked it this app. Just like everyone else has said,  removing the details and information (per kW price) that used to be there is just nuts.  It does seem deceptive. Very disappointed.

author: Paul Birnstihl
comment: No cost per unit makes Pauly sad.

author: David Wyld
comment: What can I say, with one update Powershop has gone from a company that raved to friends about to one that I now actively tell to stay away from.  Used to love the transparency and ability to purchase units in advance at a cheaper rate, now it's very hard to work anything out.  Anyway, I'm voting with my feet and have now switched to a new provider.  Was good while it lasted....

author: Gary Q
comment: Don't be fooled by the "here's how much you saved" splash page. It's not reflective of your actual savings. I already have problems with the way you calculate the bill and called multiple times with no resolution. Now you've made things even more obscure by hiding the usage information on the app. It's obvious your claims of being "transparent" are now untrue

author: Shelton Fernando
comment: Update- I called them to complain about removing KWh. The call center staff member I spoke to agreed it was a bad move and said the change wasn't liked by the staff either.  He said they were getting lots of complaints. 2 months later  powershop still hasn't listened to its customers. Time to move on.  I cannot believe they removed the cost per unit? WTF! How are we meant to know what we are spending. You have removed the thing that most customers used, very silly. I'll be making a phone call about this.

author: Andrew LeBreton
comment: No cost per unit. No units estimated end of month usage. Bring back the information that keeps us informed. Hurry up,  I am starting my search for a new provider.

author: Danney Advani
comment: Bring back cost per unit for heaven's sake! It's part of listening to your customers after all!!!

author: Thomas Van
comment: Just love this app and company.

author: Ros Prichard
comment: Like😃

author: Daniel Nash
comment: Seeing KWh per day is important because that's the main thing we control, most of the time we will use the same rate plus the special offers. Hiding this info and removing the link between KWh and $ on the charts is a big error, please put it back. Would be good if app was clearer showing the calc for the overall KWh. Also hourly usage chart doesn't work.
title: Agree with the others

author: Niall O'Callaghan
comment: Longtime powershop fan. You guys messed this amazing app up when you disabled the option to see how many units we're buying. Abysmal UX, fire your UX designer. It's deceptive and doesn't allow us consumers to know how much we're spending per unit at the point of sale. I'm switching energy supplier, this is dodgy and not transparent enough.
title: I want to see how many units I'm buying

comment: Misguided at best,  deceptive at worst. The new upgrade has taken away the whole positive experience. Maybe we were using the old system too well and saving too much? If this isn't the case they would just change it back or provide an option for those who liked the old system. I'm giving them another month then I will look elsewhere if nothing is done.
title: New update has ruined Powershop

author: Simon Hounslow
comment: Powershop took power 'units' away, now only see money representing your power usage or for an available 'power pack'. Had both now only one, money. A unit of power can cost 29c or 35c; now we don't know what we pay! Sneaky, very sneaky. Who you fooling? Why remove granular reporting functions? Put it back or I'm going elsewhere.
title: not happy.
